title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ninety-seven cats were rescued from a hoarding situation in a 1,200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island.
The Rhode Island Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals reports most cats are in good health but some have colds.
The shelter is requesting donations for supplies and medical treatment for the rescued cats via Venmo or PayPal.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran addresses trade rumors, stating he doesn't focus on them but acknowledges his parents' interest.
Red Sox's outfield depth could see Duran, primarily a DH, adjusting his role amid team competition.
Duran emphasizes a fresh start for 2026 after a dip in performance last season, despite notable past achievements.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Jordan Harris hosts hockey clinic at Warrior Ice Arena with SCORE Boston to promote accessibility in the sport.
SCORE Boston, a nonprofit, supports youth hockey by providing equipment, ice time, and transportation for children lacking opportunities.
Harris' initiative is part of broader efforts by NHL and local organizations to break barriers in hockey participation.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum's return to the Celtics court is likely around March 1, per Bill Simmons' prediction.
NBC's 90-second trailer for a docuseries on Tatum hints at his return, airing before Celtics' games.
Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 practice and is progressing ahead of schedule in his Achilles rehab.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A State Police trooper was seriously injured in a Salisbury I-95 crash while removing a ladder from the road.
The trooper, identified as Portsmouth Regional Hospital patient, is now recovering at home after the incident.
Driver Josue Levi Cuevas Santana faces charges including negligent operation and failure to move over for an emergency vehicle.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel set an Olympic record with three shutouts in a single women's hockey tournament.
Frankel helped Team USA advance to the gold medal game by defeating Sweden 5-0 in the semifinals.
Team USA will compete against Canada for the gold medal, having outscored Olympic opponents 36-1.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died and her husband went missing after falling through ice at Eastham's First Encounter Beach on Feb. 14.
Emergency responders, including divers and a technical rescue team, conducted searches but did not locate the husband.
Search efforts were suspended due to safety concerns but will resume as ice conditions change, officials stated.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants in June 2025 after disputes over his position.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed disappointment at Devers' refusal to play first base after an injury to Triston Casas.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy admitted the team might have managed Devers' position change differently before the trade.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox CEO Sam Kennedy denies claims that ownership has lost passion for winning, stressing commitment to success.
Boston traded Rafael Devers and lost Alex Bregman to free agency amid disputes over team role and contracts.
The Red Sox's projected 2026 luxury tax payroll is $256.1 million, ranked seventh-highest in MLB, showing financial commitment.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people, including the shooter, were killed at a Pawtucket, R.I. high school hockey game, three others critically injured.
The shooting at Lynch Arena was identified as a targeted family dispute, involving the shooter and two adult relatives.
Pawtucket police continue investigating, with over 100 witnesses interviewed and calls for additional information from the public.
